## addFields() function

Creates an $addFields pipeline stage for adding computed fields.

This is equivalent to MongoDB's $addFields aggregation operator. Adds new fields or replaces existing fields with computed values.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function addFields(fields: Record<string, any>): SetStage;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

fields


</td><td>

Record&lt;string, any&gt;


</td><td>

Object mapping field names to computed expressions


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[SetStage](./zero-contracts.setstage.md)

An $addFields stage

## Example


```typescript
const stage = addFields({
  isOwner: { $eq: ['$role', 'owner'] },
  fullName: { $concat: ['$firstName', ' ', '$lastName'] },
  computedAt: new Date().toISOString()
});
// { $addFields: { isOwner: ..., fullName: ..., computedAt: ... } }
```
